questions.question: What is lettering in the context of engineering drawing?

answers.b: Writing critical information on a drawing sheet

explanations.b: In engineering drawing, lettering refers to the process of writing essential information such as dimensions, notes, titles, and specifications neatly and legibly on a drawing sheet to ensure proper communication.

questions.question: Why is proper lettering important in engineering drawings?

answers.a: It adds colour to the drawing
answers.c: It only serves an aesthetic purpose

explanations.b: Proper lettering enhances the clarity and accuracy of technical information on the drawing. It ensures that engineers, fabricators, and technicians can interpret data correctly without confusion.

questions.question: What are the two main types of letters used in engineering drawings?

explanations.b: Engineering drawings commonly use Single-stroke letters for efficiency and Gothic style for clarity and uniformity. These types are standardized for technical legibility.

answers.c: Using multiple colours for each letter
answers.d: Drawing letters with a single, continuous stroke

explanations.a: Single-stroke lettering involves drawing each letter using a single, continuous stroke of uniform thickness, making it quicker to write and easier to read in technical contexts.

questions.question: Why should drawing instruments be avoided in lettering?

answers.c: They are not allowed in exams

explanations.b: Using drawing instruments like templates or stencils can be time-consuming. Freehand lettering is preferred in practice and exams due to its speed and adequacy for clarity.

questions.question: Which organization provides lettering standards in India?

explanations.a: The Bureau of Indian Standards (BIS) is the national body responsible for formulating guidelines, including those for lettering styles, sizes, and layouts in engineering drawings.

questions.question: How does single-stroke lettering ensure uniform thickness?

answers.a: By drawing each letter with one consistent stroke
answers.c: By pressing harder with the pencil
answers.d: By using multiple strokes for each letter

explanations.a: Single-stroke lettering ensures uniformity by using one controlled motion per character, maintaining even thickness across all lines, which contributes to a clean and consistent appearance.

questions.question: What is the recommended size for main titles in engineering drawings?

explanations.a: The recommended height for main titles is 6-8 mm, as per BIS standards. This size ensures visibility and prominence without overwhelming the drawing.

questions.question: What is the standard slope angle for inclined letters in engineering drawing?

explanations.b: Inclined lettering typically leans at a 75° angle to the horizontal line. This standardization improves aesthetics and helps maintain a consistent style throughout the sheet.

questions.question: What is the typical size range for sub-titles and dimension figures in drawings?

explanations.b: For sub-titles and dimension figures, the commonly accepted size is between 3 to 6 mm, allowing them to be legible without drawing too much attention away from the main content.

questions.question: How would you correct spacing if letters appear too close?

answers.b: Adjust gaps by eye for even background space
answers.c: Move words to the next line
answers.d: Use a ruler to measure gaps

explanations.b: To maintain balanced appearance, spacing between letters should be adjusted visually by observing the background space and modifying gaps to appear uniformly distributed.

questions.question: What factors determine the choice between vertical and inclined letters?

explanations.b: Vertical or inclined letters are chosen based on the nature of the drawing and its readability. Inclined lettering may offer a stylistic advantage, while vertical lettering is generally more formal and standard.

questions.question: What techniques can help achieve consistent thickness in single-stroke letters?

answers.a: Using guide-lines and controlling pencil pressure
answers.d: Using different pencils for each letter

explanations.a: Using light guide-lines for alignment and applying even pencil pressure throughout the stroke helps maintain consistent letter thickness, leading to a professional and standardized appearance.
